intro: Knautia arvensis f. tomentella, commonly known as the woolly knautia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Caprifoliaceae. It is characterized by its dense, fuzzy foliage and clusters of pink to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant is native to Central and Eastern Europe and thrives in sunny, well-drained soils. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a popular choice for garden cultivation. The foliage and flowers are both used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported health benefits.
